intro: Calochortus obispoensis, commonly known as the Obispo's mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the central coast of California. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short flowering stem. Calochortus obispoensis is a member of the lily family (Liliaceae) and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native range.
